value.string:
"""
 Return the configuration used during test.
 
 There is a difference between configuration and upgrader for
 this values. This informations should be unified later but
 for now it is better keep the difference here.
 """
 from DateTime import DateTime
 
 configuration_dict = {
 'configuration_key': 'a', # XXX: fill as appropriate for test env
 'customer_organisation_title': 'Nexedi SA',
 'customer_organisation_email': 'webproject-report@erp5.org',
 'customer_organisation_telephone': '+123 234 567 891',
 'customer_organisation_street_address': '270 bd Cl√©menceau, 59700 Marcq-en-Baroeul',
 'customer_organisation_city': 'Lille',
 'customer_organisation_zip_code': '59700',
 'customer_organisation_region': 'France',
 'customer_organisation_region_category': 'europe/western_europe/france',
 'customer_company_employees_number': 1, # employees
 'customer_user1_first_name': 'Ivan',
 'customer_user1_last_name': 'Petrov',
 'customer_user1_reference': 'PERSON_USER_REFERENCE',
 'customer_user1_used_reference' : 'PERSON_RESERVED_REFERENCE',
 'customer_user1_password' : 'secret',
 'customer_user1_function': 'Company/Manager',
 'customer_user1_email': 'webproject-report@erp5.org',
 'customer_organisation_currency' : 'Euro',
 'customer_datetime_format': 'Day / Month / Year',
 
 # XXX FIXME The follow configuration are not related to configuration itself
 # but related to system or inicial setup. Split this script later in order
 # To have a clean definition of what is the User Configuration Values only.
 "functional_test_username" : "ERP5TypeTestCase",
 "functional_test_password" : "",
 
 "business_configuration_id": "STANDARD_CONFIGURATOR_TEST",
 'bt_repository_list':['http://www.erp5.org/dists/snapshot/bt5/'],
 
 # More configurations
 "oood_hostname": "localhost",
 "oood_port": 8008,
 }
 
 return configuration_dict
